alert.note: Alert for New Madrid; Pemiscot (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Memphis (Western Tennessee, Eastern Arkansas and Northern Mississippi)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued March 17 at 7:55PM CDT until March 19 at 1:00PM CDT by NWS Memphis
info.description: ...The Flood Advisory is extended for the following rivers in Tennessee...Missouri... Mississippi River Above Tiptonville For the Lower Mississippi River...including Tiptonville, Caruthersville, Osceola, Memphis, Tunica Mhoon Landing, Helena... elevated river levels are forecast. ...FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY SATURDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...Mississippi River Above Tiptonville. * WHEN...Until early Saturday afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 35.0 feet, In Tennessee, a large section of Lake County Tennessee Road 79 is flooded near the levee. Most fields and pastures south of Stewart, Missouri, are covered by flood water. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:00 PM CDT Thursday the stage was 34.9 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall to 24.6 feet Sunday, March 27. - Action stage is 34.0 feet. - Flood stage is 37.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Additional information is available at weather.gov/memphis. The next statement will be issued as conditions warrant.
